resources.string:
Up, you men, and sing to AZA!
\ Time will pass, and we'll be on our way.
\ As the years go by there will be
\ Happiest of memories\, rah rah rah!
\ Stand and then we'll sing this song again.
\ All you loyal men
Sing the praises of our order.
\ Sing up you men of AZA\, up you men of AZA!
\ 
\ Brothers we'll be as we share our cares each day,
\ Happy and free though the years go on their way.
\ Starting anew face to face with destiny,
\ Hearts beating true for the friends and loves to be.
\ 
\ So up, you men, and sing to AZA!
\ Time will pass, and we'll be on our way.
\ As the years go by there will be
\ Happiest of memories\, rah rah rah!
\ Stand and then we'll sing this song again.
\ All you loyal men
Sing the praises of our order.
\ Sing up you men of AZA\, up you men of AZA!
\

For tomorrow and today,
\ We believe in AZA!
\ With voices loud we say we're proud of the A-Z-Aleph Tzadik Aleph.
\ We all know that Jewish life had its share of trouble and strife\,
\ But we'll never cease to work for peace in the AZ Aleph Tzadik Aleph.
\ 
\ Brotherly love and charity\,
\ we cherish and promote harmony and democracy.
\ Jewish life will never stray\,
\ Bne'i Brith is on its way\,
\ And it all began with Sam Bieber's plan for the AZ Aleph Tzadik Aleph.

In the time (In the time!)
\ Of AZA (of AZA!)
\ There lived a Jewish boy named Mordechai. (Barzilay!)
\ He was young (He was young!)
\ And insecure, (insecure!)
\ He spent his Saturdays (Saturdays!) 
\ Killing flies. (Killin flies!)
\ 
\ But there was (But there was!)
\ This guy at school (This guy at school!)
\ Who treated Mordechai (Barzilay!)
\ With sympathy, (sympathy!)
\ And he told (And he told!)
\ Him of a place (of a place!)
\ He could be anything (anything!)
\ He wished to be. (wished to be!)
\ 
\ We all live in the world of AZA, (A!)
\ The world of AZA, (Z!)
\ The world of AZA, (A!)
\ We all live in the world of AZA, (A!)
\ The world of AZA, (Z!)
\ The world of AZA, (A!)
\ 
\ At his first (At his first!)
\ Event that night (Event that night!)
\ He saw fraternity!
\ He saw the light!
\ He mailed in his check the next day.
\ Ba-da-da-dop-ba-dop-ba-dop-ba-da-da-dop-ba-dop-ba-dop
\ 
\ We all live in the world of AZA, (A!)
\ The world of AZA, (Z!)
\ The world of AZA, (A!)
\ We all live in the world of AZA, (A!)
\ The world of AZA, (Z!)
\ The world of AZA, (A!)
\ 
\ Mordechai is now a man, (is now a man!)
\ And his life (And his life!)
\ No longer bland. (No longer bland!)
\ And he lives his every day (his every day!)
\ With the power (With the power!)
\ Of AZA! (Of AZA!)
\ 
\ We all live in the world of AZA, (A!)
\ The world of AZA, (Z!)
\ The world of AZA, (A!)
\ We all live in the world of AZA, (A!)
\ The world of AZA, (Z!)
\ The world of AZA, (A!)
\

Aleph brothers of the order!
\ We're all jewish boys, some young and some older.
\ Life is great here, greater than NIFTY!
\ We support each other, we're a fraternity.
\ 
\ AZA all the way
\ For tomorrow and today
\ For the chapter, and what we're after
\ AZA all the way
\ 
\ All my memories gather round her.
\ She's a BBG and the one I'm after.
\ Maybe next year we'll hook up at JLC.
\ So what if you've seen her tits, she's the one for me.
\ 
\ AZA all the way
\ For tomorrow and today
\ For the chapter, and what we're after
\ AZA all the way
\ 
\ I hear the prayers in the evening at havdallah;
\ Traditions remind me that I'm in AZA.
\ And as we sing Air Force Ranger our bonds grow stronger each and every single day, and we say
\ 
\ (Slowly)
\ AZA all the way
\ For tomorrow and today\-\-
\ One, two, three, four\-\-
\ (Fast again)
\ For the chapter, and what we're after
\ AZA all the way
\

If tomorrow I'd be facing death, and saying goodbye to life
\ I'd be looking at the Israelis in the South bay,
\ And the East bay growing hyphe (like hyphy).
\ I'd be looking back at my time in AZA
\ And the seven cardinal principles that I live by everyday!
\ 
\ So I'm proud to be an Aleph, where I have fraternity.
\ And I won't forget the memories and the sexy BBGs.
\ So I proudly stand up with my fellow Jews during havdallah on saturdays.
\ 'Cuz I love my brother alephs and I love AZA!
\ 
\ From MoAd to Saratoga, to Sunnyvale's JSZ
\ From Peninsula AZA, to Machar and DBG
\ From San Fran down to Ramon, and SiWi to LHA (and Chai)
\ We're all connected by Cal-Train and Bart and by being from the Bay.
\ 
\ So I'm proud to be an Aleph, where I have fraternity.
\ And I won't forget the memories and the sexy BBGs.
\ So I proudly stand up with my fellow Jews during havdallah on saturdays.
\ 'Cuz I love my brother alephs and I love AZA!
\ 
\ So I'm proud to be in AZA, where everyone accepts me.
\ And I won't forget the cool events and the sexy BBGs.
\ So I raise my hand up and teach prospectives the handshake of AZA.
\ 'Cuz I love my brother alephs, and I love AZA

(Leader:)Gentlemen, put your hands together!
\ (Rest:)Clap!
\ (Leader:)I said gentlemen, put your hands together!
\ (Rest:)Clap!
\ 
\ (This next part is repeated at least twice, though sometimes more)
\ (Leader:) Ready, go!
\ (Rest:) Stomp, stomp, clap!
\ 
\ (Leader:)Gentlemen, who are we?
\ (Rest, repeatedly:) We are AZA!
\

(Each line is repeated by the group after the leader)
\ El HaMaayan!
\ Ba gdi, ba gdi katan.
\ El HaMaayan,
\ Ba gdi (hold)
\ (The group not chanting counts to 7 at the hold in "Ba gdi", then say "Katan")
\ 
\ (The song now has 3 different pathes to take. This page will present the most common order, though that may be subject to change. In addition, the "India" paragraph is sometimes omitted.)
\ 
\ Once there was a wizard
\ Who went to Africa
\ To study the Megillah
\ Megillah
\ Megillah-Gorilla
\ Megillah-Gorilla-Gorilla-Megillah
\ Megillah-Gorilla-Gorrila-Megillah-Megillah-Gorilla-Gorilla-Megillah
\ 
\ Once there was a wizard
\ Who went to China
\ To study the Torah
\ Torah
\ Torah-Horah
\ Torah-Horah-Horah-Torah
\ Torah-Horah-Horah-Torah-Torah-Horah-Horah-Torah
\ 
\ Once there was an aleph
\ Who went to India
\ To study the Mishna
\ Mishna
\ Mishna-Krishna
\ Mishna-Krishna-Krishna-Mishna
\ Mishna-Krishna-Krishna-Mishna-Mishna-Krishna-Krishna-Mishna
\

(Each line is repeated by the group after the leader)
\ Never too many!
\ Never too strong!
\ Always AZA! (Clap)
\
